{{Day}}

In the 20th and 21st centuries the [[Julian calendar]] is 13 days behind the Gregorian calendar, thus January 14 is sometimes celebrated as New Year's Day ([[Old New Year]]) by religious groups who use the Julian calendar.

==Events==
*[[1301]] &ndash; [[Andrew III of Hungary]] dies, ending the [[Árpád dynasty]] in Hungary.
*[[1343]] &ndash; [[Arnošt of Pardubice]] becomes the last [[List of bishops and archbishops of Prague|bishop of Prague]] and, subsequently, the first Archbishop of Prague.
*[[1539]] &ndash; Spain annexes [[Cuba]].
*[[1639]] &ndash; The "[[Fundamental Orders of Connecticut|Fundamental Orders]]", the first written [[constitution]] that created a [[government]], is adopted in [[Connecticut]].
*[[1724]] &ndash; King [[Philip V of Spain]] abdicates the throne.
*[[1761]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Panipat (1761)|Third Battle of Panipat]] is fought in India between the [[Afghanistan|Afghan]]s under [[Ahmad Shah Durrani]] and the Marhatas.
*[[1784]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Ratification Day (United States)|Ratification Day, United States]] - Congress ratifies the [[Treaty of Paris (1783)|Treaty of Paris]] with [[Kingdom of Great Britain|Great Britain]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Treaty of Kiel]]: [[Frederick VI of Denmark]] cedes Norway to Sweden in return for [[Pomerania]].
*[[1822]] &ndash; [[Greek War of Independence]]: [[Acrocorinth]] is captured by [[Theodoros Kolokotronis]] and [[Demetrios Ypsilantis]].
*[[1858]] &ndash; [[Napoleon III]] of France escapes an assassination attempt.
*[[1907]] &ndash; An [[1907 Kingston earthquake|earthquake in Kingston]], [[Jamaica]] kills more than 1,000.
*[[1911]] &ndash; [[Roald Amundsen]]'s [[Amundsen's South Pole expedition|South Pole expedition]] makes landfall on the eastern edge of the [[Ross Ice Shelf]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; The controversial "[[Bodyline]]" [[cricket]] tactics used by [[Douglas Jardine]]'s [[England cricket team|England]] peak when [[Australia national cricket team|Australian captain]] [[Bill Woodfull]] is hit over the heart.
*[[1938]] &ndash; Norway claims [[Queen Maud Land]] in Antarctica.
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Japan begins [[Operation Ke]], the successful operation to evacuate its forces from [[Guadalcanal]] during the [[Guadalcanal Campaign]].
*  1943   &ndash; World War II: [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] and [[Winston Churchill]] begin the [[Casablanca Conference]] to discuss strategy and study the next phase of the war.
*  1943   &ndash; World War II: Franklin D. Roosevelt becomes the first [[President of the United States]] to travel by [[airplane]] while in office when he travels from [[Miami]] to [[Morocco]] to meet with Winston Churchill.
*[[1950]] &ndash; The first prototype of the [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-17|MiG-17]] makes its maiden flight.
*[[1952]] &ndash; NBC's long-running morning news program ''[[Today (NBC program)|Today]]'' debuts, with host [[Dave Garroway]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Josip Broz Tito]] is inaugurated as the first [[List of heads of state of Yugoslavia|President of Yugoslavia]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; The [[Hudson Motor Car Company]] merges with [[Nash-Kelvinator]] Corporation forming the [[American Motors]] Corporation.
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Kripalu Maharaj]] was named fifth [[Jagadguru]] (world teacher) after giving seven days of speeches before 500 Hindu scholars.
*[[1960]] &ndash; The [[Reserve Bank of Australia]], the country's [[central bank]] and [[banknote]] issuing authority, is established.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Counterculture of the 1960s]]: The [[Human Be-In]], takes place in [[San Francisco|San Francisco, California]]'s [[Golden Gate Park]], launching the [[Summer of Love]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; An accidental explosion aboard the {{USS|Enterprise|CVN-65|6}} near Hawaii kills 27 people.
*[[1972]] &ndash; Queen [[Margrethe II of Denmark]] ascends the throne, the first Queen of Denmark since 1412 and the first Danish monarch not named Frederick or Christian since 1513.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Elvis Presley]]'s concert ''[[Aloha from Hawaii]]'' is broadcast live via [[communications satellite|satellite]], and sets the record as the [[List of most watched television broadcasts|most watched broadcast]] by an individual entertainer in television history.
*[[1975]] &ndash; Teenage heiress [[Murder of Lesley Whittle|Lesley Whittle]] is kidnapped by [[Donald Neilson]], ''aka'' "the Black Panther".
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Toronto]] Mayor [[Mel Lastman]] becomes the first mayor in Canada to call in the Army to help with emergency medical evacuations and snow removal after more than one meter of snow paralyzes the city.
*[[2000]] &ndash; A [[United Nations]] tribunal sentences five [[Croats of Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnian Croats]] to up to 25 years for the 1993 killing of over 100 Muslims in a Bosnian village.
*[[2004]] &ndash; The national flag of The Republic of [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]], the so-called "[[Flag of Georgia (country)|five cross flag]]", is restored to official use after a hiatus of some 500 years.
*[[2005]] &ndash; The [[Huygens (spacecraft)|''Huygens'' probe]] lands on [[Saturn]]'s moon [[Titan (moon)|Titan]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[Al-Qaeda insurgency in Yemen|Yemen declares an open war]] against the terrorist group [[al-Qaeda]].
*[[2011]] &ndash; The former president of [[Tunisia]], [[Zine El Abidine Ben Ali]] fled his country to [[Saudi Arabia]] after a series of street demonstrations against his regime and corrupt policies, asking for freedom, rights and democracy, considered as the anniversary of the [[Tunisian Revolution]] and the birth of the [[Arab Spring]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; The [[Pirate Party of Greece]] is founded, on the model of the Swedish [[Pirate Party (Sweden)|Pirate Party]].
